pronunciation: CONFEDERATE, [Latin] United in a league; allied by treaty; engaged in a confederacy.These were confederate with Abram. Genesis 14:13.Syria is confederate with Ephraim. Isaiah 7:2.CONFED'ERATE, noun One who is united with others in a league; a person or nation engaged in a confederacy; an ally.CONFED'ERATE, verb intransitive [Latin]

definitions.text:
Confederate
 [Latin] United in league; allied by treaty; engaged in confederacy.These were confederate with Abram. Genesis 14:13.Syria is confederate with Ephraim. Isaiah 7:2.CONFED'ERATE,
One who is united with others in league; person or nation engaged in confederacy; an ally.CONFED'ERATE,

To unite in league; to join in mutual contract or covenant.By words men come to know one another's minds; by these they covenant and confederate The colonies of America confederated in 1775.Several States of Europe have sometimes confederated for mutual safety.CONFED'ERATE,
To unite in league; to ally.With these the Piercies them confederate
